website_summaries.verdict: Impressive Amazon features and an outstanding display make the the Fire HDX 8.9 one of the best and most affordable media consumption tablets.
pros: The Amazon Fire HDX 8.9 is the first tablet with Dolby Atmos audio-enhancing technology and Amazon's item-identifying Firefly function
Its user-friendly operating system includes Mayday instant customer service, extensive parental controls and the ability to set up individual profiles
It's still one of the lightest and slimmest tablets around
cons: Amazon's curated app store has far fewer apps and games than Google and iOS app stores
The heavily modified OS leaves little room for customization and there's no microSD card slot

customer_reviews.title: Let me use my data plan
customer_reviews.text: I have plenty of capacity in my 4G data plan to download whatever I so choose at my own cost. Why does my Kindle limit me to 50 MB download of any of my Amazon purchased content when I am using my own dataplan to do it over 4G? The Kindle Fire appears to suffer from some Whispernet handicap that it's competition does not.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Original  purchase and replacement both arrived inoperable out of box
customer_reviews.text: Bought this about two weeks ago. It arrived unable to work at all. Amazon sent a replacement. The replacement was unusable. It kept on rebooting on its own over and over. Today it would not turn on at all. Mind you i own quite a few tablets apple and Android aswell as two laptops apple and windows.

My paid Android apps that had to be installed through Google Play work beautifully.

customer_reviews.text: The best tablet on the market if it is still out there. I have a problem with my Bluetooth function so I needed it replaced thanks to the insurance I bought for it on Amazon. I was told I did qualify for a replacement but there were none available and to keep an open eye for when the did. That was 3 months ago. I want my replacement I was promised before the insurance runs out and yet it seems I own a discontinued model that is not coming back.

customer_reviews.title: Good luck. Being an Amazon Prime member does seem ...
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy. As a result of recent update, I am no longer able to download music purchased from Amazon Prime. After spending more than an hour online or on the phone with "HELP" - "Customer Service", I still don't have a solution. I had to fight for refund. Somethings that once worked now don't...with no apparent solution. I can do everything I used to but now no music. Reading Fire HDX reviews and searching blogs they seem to be littered with similar problems. Good luck. Being an Amazon Prime member does seem to me to be the bargain I thought it was.

customer_reviews.title: Charging problems
customer_reviews.text: I Love the tablet BUT!!!!!! I'm having a major problem w/ charging the battery. I contacted them and they sent me a new charger BUT!!!!, it's been charging for 8hrs now and it went from 20% to 77%. I think something's wrong here when I have to charge it for 8hrs for <3hrs use. Is this the norm for this device? I hope not. I also have a 7" hdx tablet that goes from a dead battery to 100% in 3hrs which I think is appropriate. What's NOT appropriate is that I'm still using it cause the 8.9" tablet is on the chager. Is anyone else having this problem or is something wrong? PLEASE respond. TY.

customer_reviews.title: I am very disappointed with this product
customer_reviews.text: I am very disappointed with this product. It is a waste of money. Sometimes it works and most of the time it doesn't. I did not research this product before I bought it. I have other Kindle products and have no problems. thinking this is the same I had to get a Lemon. LIVE AND LEARN. I DO NOT RECOMEND THIS TABLET.

customer_reviews.title: Not satisfied.
customer_reviews.text: I returned it. Half the apps I tried to download were unavailable. Others like History locked up when attempted. Calendar wouldn't sync. Email did but was a cluttered mess with no way to adjust it. Light, yes, but because it's plastic. Can't tap the screen to bring out of sleep mode. Ads, ads, ads everywhere, including in the apps I did manage to download. Not even primitive productivity functionality. Nice for watching videos and reading books, and that's about it.

customer_reviews.title: OS5.1.1 System update

I still put this at the top but I wish my battery was as good as it was the day I purchased it. Has anyone else noticed a difference after the update?
customer_reviews.author: Jaybird 78

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after 21 months
customer_reviews.text: Purchased the Fire HDX 8.9 32GB Wi-Fi in Dec '14 and loved it until it stopped working 21 months later. It suffered no damage or mishandling. It worked as expected one day and then a blank screen the next day. It will power up and produce sounds, but the screen is black. The only "support" Amazon is offering is for me to purchase a new model. Sigh... I guess I will cancel my Prime membership and switch to the iPad. Disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Becky Bogle

customer_reviews.title: Should be more reliable considering the price
customer_reviews.text: In many ways it is good. However, after just 7 or 8 months it began acting like a 7 or 8 year old PC. It regularly freezes or the video goes dark while still having audio. I cannot recommend it. It's too bad because, though it has a lot of nice features, I feel kind of ripped off. I expected a machine that cost $425 to serve me well for much longer.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Edward Hendricks

customer_reviews.title: Junk don't purchase!
customer_reviews.text: With its constant freezing, not worth it. When it does freeze it causes all downloads to error and are unplayable. This includes PURCHASED movies!! You have to reboot and refresh whilst online. This doesn't help if your on a 11 hr flight and your tablet freezes up within the first hour. Big waste of money. But don't fret it makes a handy paper weight....sigh.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Defelice

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful new way of carrying a computer with you.
customer_reviews.text: It is amazing. Much smarter than I am, but with Mayday available 24x7, boy they can get me out of any jam. Including strawberry and blackberry (LOL). With Messenger I can even call any of my friends on Facebook. Really weird. And with the camera, takes wonderful pictures, except it keeps telling me to hold the thing straight. This is truely a great tablet. One of my better purchases. Haven't figured out how to use the keyboard, better call Mayday again.

customer_reviews.title: Fine machine but poor font selection/controls in email...the OS has no ASCII characters.
customer_reviews.text: Pretty happy with I'Net capabilities, but issues with email, a big item for me with it; almost impossible to see the cursor in email text, OS has no ASCII, so few if any special characters...tilde, accents, degree sign, cent sign, hundreds of others not available. The font set is very limited (and not displayed, only the name). Access to font control for bold, color, italics, at the bottom, not a dropdown-inconvenient. Windows controls (Alt B for Bold for example, don't work right. It bolds italics...I don't WANT italics in bold. Font size selected is lost if you save to Draft. Maybe they'll make some enhancements...I wrote these and other issues to Amazon/Kindle support.
customer_reviews.author: TheAeroSmith

customer_reviews.title: Useful tablet.
customer_reviews.text: This tablet, which I understand is no longer available from Amazon, has 4G broadband capability. Requires a sim card from an Internet provider. Access can be purchased for limited periods -- say for two weeks while on vacation.. However, using a sim card for 4g broadband can be used only in the US. International use would require a sim card from a provider that offers access outside of the US.

customer_reviews.title: This tablet is just like new

customer_reviews.title: Wondering if Amazon sent me a unit that was returned ...
customer_reviews.text: Wondering if Amazon sent me a unit that was returned by someone else. It takes more than 4hours to charge up fully. A few times after charging for about 4 hours, it was still only about 60% charged. A number of times, after charging it would not turn on. Would do so after about an hour or so. My wife also has had the same problem with her previous version Kindle Fire. I'm beginning to think there is an issue with the battery/power system. Also when it does come on the words "Amazon", then "Fire" are upside down. The log in screen that follows then flips around the right way. Is this normal?

customer_reviews.title: ABSOLUTELY AMAZING!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is my first tablet. It was on sale for $299 one day before Valentine's Day and I seized the opportunity! My sister was recently hospitalized and I spent 8 days sitting with her. Kindle Fire HDX was my salvation! While she slept I could read, watch movies, or play games (using ear phones). I have barely scratched the surface of what this tablet can do, but I can say that watching videos could not be better. The picture quality is fantastic and the sound (using cheap earbuds) is unbelievable! It also takes beautiful photos and reading is really easy on the eyes. I'm still on a learning curve but I fully enjoy what I am already able to do.
customer_reviews.author: JaneAustenFan73

customer_reviews.title: I have four HDX's (4* 8.9" & 4* 7") all with AT&T or Verizon. No problems so far (2019)
customer_reviews.text: I have four HDX's (3 8.9" & 1 7") all with AT&T or Verizon. No problems so far (fingers crossed)--nothing else compares with them. It's July 2019 and my four 4th gen HDX 8.9's are doing great, no problems. (I have four HDX 7's also.) I miss having a microSD card. I suppose some day the batteries will die and replacement batteries will no longer be available and I'll have to drop down to the current HD series. I love having a cellular modem like my Kindles have but the HDs do not. I bought all eight HDXs NIB; NIB HDXs with cellular modems are now very expensive if you can find one.
customer_reviews.author: Doug Jensen

customer_reviews.title: As much as I enjoy the feel and hardware of this tablet
customer_reviews.text: As much as I enjoy the feel and hardware of this tablet, the inability to install the apps of my choosing will prevent me from buying another. I would have no problem giving it 5 stars except the two main apps I want to use aren't available for no good reason. Amazon, please stop crippling me by barring the Google Play store! Your apps are over there, they're not afraid of you. Why are you afraid of them? edit: downgraded to 2 stars because it's just too tough to get the apps I want, not even a web browser! Too locked down, would not purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: JEFF T.

customer_reviews.title: New OS has caused charging issues.
customer_reviews.text: I bought my Fire in August 2015 and loved every bit of it. Come February 2016 and the new OS push and I can't charge the tablet past 80% and it takes hours just to get it charged to there. Yes Amazon, I'm using your OEM chargers. By other reviewers I'm not alone! Fix it!!
customer_reviews.author: harleychick3cat

customer_reviews.title: Not there yet...
customer_reviews.text: I really like the seamless access to the Amazon store, including Amazon Prime. The display is excellent. Battery life is fine. All this said, there are very good reasons why the iPad pretty much rules the market (I own both). First, the iOS software platform is so much cleaner and intuitive. The iPad hardware is excellent and beats the Fire HDX in many ways, ranging from the ease of plugging in the connector to being able to effortlessly recognize where the physical buttons are. I am a big fan of Amazon, but the Fire HDX has a long, long way to go.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Missing the HD port.
customer_reviews.text: I am a big fan of kindle products. I now have a new kindle e-reader paper white after I tried to kill a spider by throwing my second generation kindle reader at it. Yes I hate spiders. I also have a 8.9 Kindle Fire HD and a newer Kindle Fire HDX 8.9. I love all my kindles, however, I do miss having the HD port I have used for years to connect my fire to my tv. My Kindle Fire 8.9 has it, of course, but my newest Kindle Fire HDX 8.9 does not. That was not a nice thing to do. Other than that, I love my product.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: I have no problem with the one I purchased for myself (I love it) but the 2 others that I have purchased ...
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased several Kindles for myself and family members. I have no problem with the one I purchased for myself (I love it) but the 2 others that I have purchased for my family members they can't say the same. They love the actual Kindle when it's able to charge. After about 6-8 months they stop charging. So far Amazon has been pretty good at replacing them.
customer_reviews.author: Christine G

customer_reviews.title: Still the Best
customer_reviews.text: I was not surprised when shortly after I got mine, Amazon released new versions with a welcome micro-SD card port. I was surprised that the new models, even the big 10" model had resolution much less than this one's 2560 x 1600 screen. As far as I'm concerned, this is still the one to beat. It hooks up well to my 802.11ac AP, even on the 5GHz band where some devices seem to stumble. Since I'm surrounded by 2.4GHz signals, I like a quick hookup on the high band. Every bit as nice as what Apple sells.
customer_reviews.author: Speed Daemon

customer_reviews.title: Kindle HDX 8.9
customer_reviews.text: Amazon just updated the software for this piece that makes this unit clumsy, confusing , and no longer customer friendly.
customer_reviews.author: Jayne K. Sundermeyer

customer_reviews.title: Do not recommend this product at all
customer_reviews.text: Do not recommend this product at all. This is my second one and both have been a waste of money. The first kindle lasted longer than this latest generation one. I've had this new generation kindle hdx 8.9 for only 3 MONTHS and it already doesnt work. It doesnt turn on and stays frozen in the start screen. Another 400 dollars down the drain.
customer_reviews.author: Javier Jimenez

customer_reviews.title: Love it, but...
customer_reviews.text: I love having the 4G capability and it is very fast...much faster than wifi, but the downside is the fact that it uses up the battery extremely quickly. I have purchased an auxiliary battery pack that I'm sure will be needed frequently. Other than that, I'm satisfied with the product. I have had my initial kindle 8.9 HD for many years and love it, but I really wanted the 4G ability for travel, when a phone screen is way too small. I am sad that Amazon has not updated the HDX 4G capable tablet since 2014 because they may have been able to improve on battery usage which would be a real plus.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good only if you want it for Amazon-based entertaiment
customer_reviews.text: I really like the design, and because it is smaller than iPad air it makes it easier to hold it. The major problem is that there are not many applications on the market, and most of them are for pay. You won't find a lot of accessories for this also. This is a good tablet for those who will want it mainly for Amazon-based entertaiment. You won't have most Google applications even the most common, and you will need to forget about other common applications you are used to in Apple's or Android devices. The other thing that bothered me is that you need frequently to reboot it because it tends to freeze once or twice a day.
customer_reviews.author: Mark S (Detroit, MI)

customer_reviews.title: Double edged sword
customer_reviews.text: Very nice display, crisp and clean. Just have a couple of problems. Cannot charge it in a plug where other items are also plugged in. It pops up a message that says that the power is too low to charge and may not charge if used while charging. Have to plug it into a lone plug all by itself in the corner. The other thing is that it freezes once in a while, sometimes more than once in a day, especially when playing backgammon or yahtzee. And it continually loses connection to my home wifi even when in the same room. I do love the portability though and is great when it is behaving itself.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry Rogdeberg

customer_reviews.title: 8.9" Fire HDX exceeds expectations.
customer_reviews.text: I sent a suggestion to Amazon years ago about the Kindle Fire. My big point was that the screen needed to be about one inch larger in each direction. -- And this 8.9 device does meet that requirement. The features for the future should be 1) an HDMI output 2) a replaceable battery 3) a low priced protective cover (not the expensive Origami). 4) A Bluetooth connector. I still use the Kindle Fire (7 inch) about 10% of the time since it is more portable. However, I prefer the larger format for about 90% of my reading. I also like the sound quality of the new device and the picture quality for viewing Amazon movies is excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: It is lighter than the old HD 8. 9 ...
customer_reviews.text: It is lighter than the old HD 8.9. Has a smaller cord. I am using the old tablet cover, however it has the on/off button in the back, which causes you to remove it from the cover to turn it on/off. Not sure I want to invest in a new cover, as the old tablet stopped working (turns on, but will not load the main page) after three years. Called tech support and said I had a virus x$ to fix. Update 7/6/16 I find this one always freezes on me. I will not purchase another HDX. I will look at another brand when this one dies.
customer_reviews.author: Tryhard

customer_reviews.title: The awesome 8.9 HDX
customer_reviews.text: My 3rd Kindle.....this one by far is more superior than any in the Amazon's inventory...although the inventory for these types of HDX are limited, it's still a superior choice over all....I compared the size of the 8.9 to the iPad and the Mini's and the 8.9 is in between the two....Price point the 8.9 is competitive among the three...If you're tied into the Amazon's environment and Prime, like I am, then this is the way to go. I have two Kindle, the 2nd generation 7", which I use when traveling; and the 8.9 which I use at home.....the graphics on the 8.9 are awesome and no comparison to later models
customer_reviews.author: Rockfish

customer_reviews.title: Even the federal government allows you to depreciate an item like this over three years
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item 2 years ago and it is now rendered ineffective. Amazon has basically stopped supporting apps on this device. NBC sports and Showtime stopped working after the update in October. Two years after I purchased this product. This also means the tablet is completely worthless for resale. I'm furious that this tablet didn't even last three years. Even the federal government allows you to depreciate an item like this over three years. I would expect Amazon to do the same. This is precisely why Amazon makes an inferior product compared to companies like Google or Apple. Don't buy Amazon products you will be severely disappointed
customer_reviews.author: michael a ell

customer_reviews.title: End of an era.
customer_reviews.text: I brought this tablet in 2015. It has been very reliable; however, it is getting old. I was going to replace it with a new Fire tablet; unfortunately, all the current models would be a downgrade. None of the current models have 4G. In the time since I bought this tablet, there has not been a week go by where I did not have to rely on 4G for a time. For example, I would not be able to post this review if I did not have 4G.
customer_reviews.author: Richard H. Langley

customer_reviews.title: Thoughts on my new Fire HDX 8.9 (4th gen).
customer_reviews.text: Display on the Fire HDX 8.9 is great. Silk browser is slow. Extremely disappointing that the Chrome browser is not in Amazon App Store and you can't access Google Play Store to get it (come on Amazon, quit being so possessive with your empire). Very few apps in the Amazon App Store compared to the Google Play Store. Hopefully Amazon will loosen up and allow access to the Google Play Store in the near future like the Barnes and Noble Nook finally did. It is very good for watching Amazon Prime Videos though. Also reading Kindle e-books on it is a pleasure.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic product.....only one flaw though
customer_reviews.text: I really love this but am I the only one having this problem. This is my 3 kindle. The first two I had lasted about 3 years and then I had problems charging them. And of course the warranty ran out. My daughter bought this one for me in June 2015 and 2 days ago the same thing again....would not charge. Now this was only 6 months! I called and after doing all the trouble shooting it was decided I needed a new one. Now this was under the warranty (thank god) I really love the Kindles.. Everything about them is wonderful.....but the whole charging issue needs to be addressed. Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: Cindy Wiggins

customer_reviews.title: The best Kindle ever!
customer_reviews.text: I love my Kindle Fire HDX, this is my second tablet. I had my first one for more than three years and when it went out I had to get another one and I couldn't get it fast enough. I use my HDX to do everything. I read, check my email, watch movies and TV shows and pay my bills and many more things. The only complaint that I have is the battery time, it doesn't seem to last as long as my first one did. Other than that I couldn't be more happier with it. I highly recommend the Kindle HDX to everyone.
customer_reviews.author: Fuzzarilly

customer_reviews.title: To bad WiFi is so glitchy...
customer_reviews.text: WiFi troubles detract lots--this has trouble connecting to the Internet over many hotel WiFis, despite connecting to the network okay and receiving a strong signal apparently. Using my hotspot and home WiFis (at my apartment and others'), no problems arise. After researching, I've tweaked every advanced setting to no avail, attempting to use this as a laptop substitute while traveling. So now I leave this mobile device behind. With the 7-inch HDX tablet I this doesn't happen, but it's got other issues.
customer_reviews.author: ECP

customer_reviews.title: Loved it while 4G worked... 4G stopped working in Feb 2017
customer_reviews.text: Loved this Fire HDX until February 2017 when 4G simply stopped working. Verizon changed out the SD card and still didn't work. Many emails and phone calls with Kindle 'help' and still cannot get it to work. Five stars because I did enjoy it while it worked.Sad that even Kindle support cannot figure it out.
customer_reviews.author: Bonkerz

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed...
customer_reviews.text: I had the same issue as Weston described, same scenario and everything! What really upsets me is that this was the best tablet they ever made as far as display and performance goes and they don't make anything comparable to trade it in for. I really enjoyed my HDX over the newer crappy kindles they sell now... Blows my mind that their newer models are worse than this one. I would pay them more to get another of this model that I could use for more than two months! I was really looking forward to the new OS that promised Google app store app compatibility. Very sad.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: This was such a disappointment for me and I am going to return the ...
customer_reviews.text: This was such a disappointment for me and I am going to return the product. It started right out of the box and it continued until I called to return the product. Every time I turned on the tablet it was froze on the home screen. I never enjoyed the actual use of the product. I know its bad to compare products but I never heard on anyone having this type of problems with an IPad..so guess what I will be purchasing. Sorry Amazon you failed me and I will not be frustrated again!
customer_reviews.author: Garfield

customer_reviews.title: All in with Amazon Prime?
customer_reviews.text: I love my fire phone (even tho they don't sell them anymore). The 8.9 HDX seamlessly flows from one project to the next, the images are incredible, and the speakers are better than I expected. Even though mine can operate with a SIM I tether it from my fire phone and so far it has never dropped. Other than worrying that Amazon will snub the 8.9 HDX like it has the Fire Phone concerning updates and support. I still recommend it as a great tablet. As for Amazon? "Please continue to support our Fire Phones. It makes it hard to go all in with Prime and the products it supports.

customer_reviews.title: We have a winner.
customer_reviews.text: Truthfully, I didn't expect to like this as much as I do. I've had Kindle Keyboards for years now, love them. Not crazy about a touch screen, and my old Fire was too heavy to be comfortable, but this one is bigger, yet thinner, and with the origami cover is working out well. I did get the keyboard for it as I don't like the on-screen keyboard much. This is now my "companion" Kindle - the one that goes with me everywhere.
customer_reviews.author: Pogonip

customer_reviews.title: It worked for the first 6 months just fine but since before Dec of 2015 it runs hot
customer_reviews.text: This is a piece of s***. It worked for the first 6 months just fine but since before Dec of 2015 it runs hot, turns off in the middle of being on, I think there is something wrong with the battery. Has anybody else had this problem? I paid a lot of money for this to not work properly. I cannot find a phone number to call. I need some help.
customer_reviews.author: DEBORAH STIVERS

customer_reviews.title: Great deal on a used Fire
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased with it. The specs are readily available to read on the Amazon site so I'm not gonna repeat all that. This is a used/refurb with possible scratches etc. on the case. I found mine to be near mint condition such that it looked brand new. I think it's a steal for the price I paid for it. 'nuff said.
customer_reviews.author: Steve H

customer_reviews.title: I'm disappointed in this Kindle
customer_reviews.text: I'm disappointed in this Kindle. It keeps freezing up. I contacted help and they say they fixed it but it still freezes up. This is my 6th Kindle. I get a new one every time a new type comes out. This is the first time I have been disappointed. Sorry I bought it.Paid $400.00 for it.
customer_reviews.author: tonie

customer_reviews.title: SHOULD HAVE BOUGHT THE CHROMEBOOK 11 FIRST
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the Fire HDX 8.9" Wi-Fi with 32GB in June 2015. I like it ok but its my 3rd. Kindle and Kindles still don't seem all that user friendly. I immediatly had problems with loading my games that the techs couldn't solve. If I had bought my Chromebook first I never would have gotten the Kindle 8.9". ( I am past my return date or I would return the Kindle.) The Chromebook is friendly out of the box and is almost 1/3 the price of the Kindle.
customer_reviews.author: C. Craig

customer_reviews.title: Excellent tablet. I wish some features were easier to ...
customer_reviews.text: Excellent tablet. I wish some features were easier to configure, and I wish it had access to more apps like the google store. But if you are a heavy Amazon user, you will really like this tablet. Addition: After owning this for half a year, I must say that I really like everything about it except the parental controls. They are absolutely infuriating. There are so many things that are flat-out blocked, and you have no say in the matter. You can allow certain apps, but if Amazon decides not to allow it, you will not see it in your child's profile, no matter what you want. This almost makes the device useless for me.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic tablet.
customer_reviews.text: I love this tablet. Purchased this tablet after considering the iPad and other high end tablets. This tablet had everything I wanted and since I am a Prime member it made even more sense. The screen resolution is fantastic and this tablet is fast. The apps Amazon offers allow me to do everything I need to. The sound on this tablet is also much better than on my previous tablets. This would be a great purchase for anyone who wants a high quality tablet with all the benefits that come from it being an Amazon product. This tablet will not disappoint.
customer_reviews.author: Janet B.

customer_reviews.title: if they are deleted so easily? Would like a cloud that kept the info
customer_reviews.text: Had troubles with the first Fire rec. 10/23/14; replacement received on 11/21/14. A few days ago, the camera app. completely disappeared and talking with Tech. Support, had to finally Factory Reset. After spending an hour loading photos to the new Fire Cloud, the Reset erased all the photos. Why would you create a Cloud to store Photos, etc., if they are deleted so easily? Would like a cloud that kept the info., as with game apps., books, etc. I know there is a privacy issue, but a person can delete one or all photos or documents when we want. Please "fix" the Factory Reset" button; thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Barb

customer_reviews.title: Simply the best from all the rest!
customer_reviews.text: This is my 4th upgrade of Kindle. Decided to go all the way to 64 GB. Love the larger screen for viewing movies, and the higher resolution Is fantastic. I also enjoy playing the hidden object games to relax. The bigger screen makes it a lot easier. I am a loyal customer of the Kindle tablet. I wouldn't dare think of going to another brand. With my Prime membership the adventure have just begun. I find myself using my desktop computer less and less. The 8.9. tablet is big enough for me. I'll never go higher than that.
customer_reviews.author: wysingm

customer_reviews.title: BLAZING FAST WI-FI?
customer_reviews.text: This tablet is by far the best of the fire family. You can't get a better kindle then the hdx 8.9. I have several other kindls which I've reviewed, and this one stands out. It's much thinner, faster, and better looking . It has a soft rubbery back, which has a nice solid feel to it. Doesn't feel cheap at all. The Wi-Fi is much quicker over my kindle fire 6 or 7. I don't recommend this tablet if all you want to do is read, but if you want a more versatile tablet, which can be used as a computer or tv. Then this tablet may be for you.
customer_reviews.author: ryan

customer_reviews.title: I like it, but was disappointed when I found out ...
customer_reviews.text: I like it, but was disappointed when I found out I couldn't use apps from another source than Amazon.I like to watch Nasa site and can't with this. I am sure as I go along I will find other things it won't do, as I haven't really used it that much other than reading books. I will definitely check out the next tablet I buy. I thought I had done enough checking on this one, but evidently I didn't check far enough. Lesson learned I hope, because this tablet wasn't cheap and it was more expensive than most others. I thought it would do almost what a little computer would do.
customer_reviews.author: J. L. Blackburn

customer_reviews.title: Kindle Fire BEWARE!
customer_reviews.text: Not sure if I just got a bad one or they all are this bad but be aware before you buy. The unit will not stay connected to the internet either here at home where we have high speed fiber or at any other location we have tried. Talked with customer service and they have yet to provide us with any resolve. They do not understand this is a problem with the Kindle Fire not the internet connection. After a little research I learned this is a very common problem with this unit. At this point I simply want to return it and get my money back. All other purchasing experiences with Amazon have been satisfactory.
customer_reviews.author: Margaret Franklin

customer_reviews.title: This model has far too many 'glitches'... ...
customer_reviews.text: This model has far too many 'glitches'... and this is my 2nd try with the hdx...camera works only part time...needs rebooting to make it work. Mayday operators are hard to get sometimes,,and they often have no clue. Sorry amazon - you need to fix the problems. I can't be alone in this.
customer_reviews.author: bill pratt

customer_reviews.title: Fire Away!!!
customer_reviews.text: This newer version of the Kindle Fire blew past my other Kindle, though the previous was great itself, and I'm thoroughly enjoying all of the extras, the improvements on the sound system and how much louder it is, having more options on the camera and right down to the new sound effects!!! The Kindle Fire is a great tablet all around, and there's one thing that makes this top quality: It's Amazon!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: David J. Brumbaugh

customer_reviews.title: Great tablet, but unfortunately not the one I needed
customer_reviews.text: I liked it. Loads videos really fast. But it doesn't accept all android apps or has customized android apps that are different. At the time I tried it, I was managing 2 or 3 FB pages and several Twitter accts. The Fire HDX was very sharp and fast, but it gave me more challenges than i cared to deal with app wise. But for most people's everyday use, this is a really good tablet.
customer_reviews.author: D Barrett

customer_reviews.title: Wow! This is great.
customer_reviews.text: Wow! This is so much better than my later model Kindles. I can even read the Washington Post without having to reload multiple times.
customer_reviews.author: M. J. Kline

customer_reviews.title: You go Amazon!
customer_reviews.text: I always wonder how Amazon will top their previous versions but they always do. This new Fire HDX 8.9 is beautiful. It has a new music feature which is more like surround sound and some new video enhancement to prevent buffering. Also, like the Fire phone, the tablet now has Firefly, the ability to use the camera on anything and it will take you right to the product for purchase. This is great for Prime members. There is a slight modification to the log on screen but overall it's very similar in design to previous generations. And my favorite feature, the Mayday button, is still there. Geez I love that Mayday button.
customer_reviews.author: Bettikins

customer_reviews.title: Kindle HDX 8.9 4th Gen Greatness!!!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased the unit and was a bit taken back at how locked down it was. SCREEN and SPEED is outstanding and without a doubt the best I have seen. But without having the entire GOOGLE PLAY at your disposal. The Tablet is minimized and not used to its potential. Size,Weight,Sound,Speed,and Picture!! WOW... I am looking for another one so I can have one for travel and one for home.. YES I like it that much..
customer_reviews.author: LEBEAU75

customer_reviews.title: Wife love it
customer_reviews.text: My wife loves it but this is the 2nd one. the first one broke (charger plug we believe) just 2 weeks after the warranty ran out so had to purchase new one which is the new generation so hope it last longer
customer_reviews.author: skipper

customer_reviews.title: It was easy to set up and have two Amazon accounts added ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a Christmas gift. It was easy to set up and have two Amazon accounts added to it. We primary use it to watch movies. Easy to download or stream movies. Easy to hook up to the tv to watch movies with the adapter. The only thing I dislike is the adds on the locked screen. Paid extra to have them removed yet it is still there. The screen is very crisp and clear.
customer_reviews.author: Cameala Freed

customer_reviews.title: not worth my time or money to upgrade to a new kindle fire
customer_reviews.text: this was my second kindle fire that I purchased and based on the first kindle I purchased and this one I may never purchase a kindle fire again. my first kindle fire was very user-friendly and when I downloaded files I could rename them so I could find them again when I needed them. I have had the kindle fire 8.9 version for over 3 years now and have finally come to the conclusion that it is worthless to me if I can not locate the files I have previously downloaded. So tell me why it would be worth my time and money to ungrade to a new kindle!
customer_reviews.author: Stacy Ponder

customer_reviews.title: WHAT'S NOT TO LIKE!
customer_reviews.text: Have no quarrel with any feature of this Fire. So far have had perfect performance. Have seen some reviews complaining about the camera. Did not expect Nikon quality here anymore than I would on a cell phone. This camera is a nice-to-have convenience when needed. The user has a lot to do with the quality of the result. I use this Fire primarily for audio books: the stereo speakers are great! You will notice a"big" improvement over earlier Fires. Better than my laptop. The swipe feature is a marvel as it was on my Fire HD6. Enjoy!
customer_reviews.author: ann  G.

customer_reviews.title: Kindle works so far OS sucks
customer_reviews.text: Received today and was glad to receive. This is a better size than the 10 so far downloading seems to be going ok. Only thing I really hate is the OS, as I'm already have a 10 and hated its OS i was hoping that this used 8.9 would have the old OS. This new os also has a problem of changing what you type so it twice as long to type something
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love it love it love it
customer_reviews.text: Love it love it love it!!! But then I love all of my Kindles from the first Fire I bought to this one!!! The camera is great, the screen is very vivid - I HIGHLY recommend to everyone I know - buy a Kindle, you will not be sorry. And yes, I was one of those that thought an eReader could never replace the feel, smell, and love of a good book, but lack of home storage for my beloved books is what lead me to the Kindle in the first place and now I can't live w/out it. My Kindle is like the saying "I don't leave home without it"!!!
customer_reviews.author: ktay27

customer_reviews.title: Unexpected differences from previous Fire HDX jarring
customer_reviews.text: 1. I thought restore would leave new system with all apps installed in new Fire, but so far I have had to download 6 games and Facebook before I could use them. 2. Operating system now displays all open windows, butI haven't found a "close all" command. 3. Display of book collections seem to have been redesigned. Titles of collections are too small. With large number of books, the list display is more useful to me than the graphic display, but I haven't found that yet.
customer_reviews.author: Rita

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: This thing stopped working about 2 years ago. We grew tired of messing with it and just bought an iPad, which has been awesome. I guess at this point I should just throw it away?
customer_reviews.author: RickandGary

customer_reviews.title: Very Pleased with Performance
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this as a replacement for a 7" that was stolen during travel. I like the rear camera, the larger size has not been a problem. I use the device primarily for entertainment so I cant evaluate it for any other application. The video is crisp and clear and the sound more than adequate. I am also pleasntly surprised at the battery life which actually seems longer than the smaller 7" version. I got this unit on sale prior to christmas for $150 off which made the cost more reasonable. I would never have purchased this version without the discount since my use is purely entertainment related. Very pleased with the purchase and performance of the tablet.
customer_reviews.author: D. Webber

customer_reviews.title: Terrific table -- flimsy shipping envelope
customer_reviews.text: This is my fifth Kindle and I am very pleased (and yes, I use them all)! The video quality is exceptional and the audio is much, much better that previous versions. The camera and video quality are impressive. Basically, it is everything I expected from its description on Amazon. My only negative comment is the packaging. To me, this is an expensive item and it arrived in a thinly padded mailing envelope. Perhaps, if the envelope had been marked "Fragile," the deliveryman would not have tossed it onto our concrete walkway. The tablet survived undamaged, but it should have had more protective packaging. The $10 cover I ordered arrived in a very sturdy box:-)
customer_reviews.author: PawsFurFun

customer_reviews.title: Almost 5 stars
customer_reviews.text: Tablet has a beautiful screen and awesome sound all in a perfect size and weight, I like OS although it should be more integrated with google I believe, but over all it is nice and I like it, it seems to be a bit buggy at times and requires a reboot and that's the only real problem I have with it. Now as far as how Amazon has the setup for multiple fire pads is a whole other situation, seems like everything I place on my pad makes its way over to my wife's and my children's pads too regardless of the settings and that is a real pain!!
customer_reviews.author: Brad B.

customer_reviews.title: LOVED it until they pushed the OS upgrade
customer_reviews.text: Was happy with this, my 4th Kindle, UNTIL they pushed the new OS. The foreground of the screen is cluttered, the background of the screen is cluttered (with NO way to turn off the ugly wallpaper options). Sound controls are limited -- despite being in Do Not Disturb mode, my kindle still chimes whenever I receive an e-mail or other alert. Not the first OS upgrade I have encountered over the years, just the first I have absolutely ABHORRED!
customer_reviews.author: Curious

customer_reviews.title: Can't beat this Kindle Fire
customer_reviews.text: Love my new Kindle Fire HDX 8.9. I purchased it because I would be flying to Washington D.C. and did not want to be bored on the long flight. I am so happy that I did. Being technology challenged I love the help feature. Someone to talk me through using my Kindle if I can't figure things out myself; fantastic. When I have asked them for help they are so polite. It's just like the add. I downloaded some movies using my Amazon Prime account and watched them on my flight. It was fantastic; sorry if I am repeating myself. It is lightweight and slim as well. What else could you ask for?
customer_reviews.author: Debra A. Becker

customer_reviews.title: Suggestion for improvement to Fire HDX 8.9
customer_reviews.text: I recently purchased the new Fire HDX 8.9. It is fast and basically everything I hoped it would be. The one improvement I would suggest is to increase the font text size adjustments. The biggest font size is +3. This is a problem for me with online banking. The text sizes for downloading books allows for ample adjustments......but for web reading, text size seems limited. To have the option to adjust font sizes above 3 would make my new Fire perfect. This is my 3rd kindle and I love your tablets.
customer_reviews.author: Louise  McLaughlin

customer_reviews.title: Waste of your money
customer_reviews.text: Waste of money. Product is overated and overpriced. Can't merge AOL, contacts, issues with most text apps, can't copy and paste photos, cheated on 12GB of hard drive with who knows what on the device, has issues with many apps made/intended for use on the Kindle. A lot of the popular apps have many bugs and glitches. On the positive side its graphics are immensely beautiful along with good sound quality, other than that I feel other reviews gave me a completely false sense on this product. I personally see it as a big waste of money. After all it cost me over $525 between product, taxes and shipping. iPod touch has way better capabilities than this product.
customer_reviews.author: Shadow Bear

customer_reviews.title: Perfect tablet to compliment Amazon Prime subscription!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect tablet to use around the house. Full Android power, with Amazon easy-to-use interface. I prefer this Fire HDX over the Apple iPad2 tablets that we also have. The Fire HDX has that svelte black texture on the back to make it easy to handle, same surface used on the Amazon Fire TV Remote and a lot of other hi-tech gadgets that feel "sexy" to the touch. I use this to surf the web from the couch, watch movies and Amazon Prime videos from anywhere, and browse ahead for content prior to watching a movie on one of the big screens that are driven by the Amazon Fire TV appliances.
customer_reviews.author: Mad-Gunner

customer_reviews.title: It is easy to turn on and off
customer_reviews.text: I had the 2012 version & had so much trouble with the power switch. Well, this is not only new and improved, it's delightful! It has an actual button that really works and is labeled with a power sign. It is easy to turn on and off. It continues to have great graphics and is very clear. I could not be more pleased. Customer service helped me when I had a problem with the older version and I know I can count on Amazon to make sure I am satisfied with their product and service. I recommend this tablet to anyone in the market to buy a tablet. Thank you once again Amazon for great service!
customer_reviews.author: Diana

customer_reviews.title: It does take great pictures in either view front or back camera
customer_reviews.text: I purchased two of these and they work for what we needed them to do. We used them on vacation and took many pictures. The internet browser seemed a little slow. I wish i could download chrome for the browser. It does do social media and kindle books and movies.All in all it was worth the price however if you want to add more memory forget There is no place to add an sd card. It does take great pictures in either view front or back camera. The nice thing is I was able to connect all the profiles my family uses with my main Fire HDX so I can keep track of them all.
customer_reviews.author: zztigger

customer_reviews.title: Love the 4th Generation Fire HDX 8.9" tablet
customer_reviews.text: Love, love , love the 4th Generation Fire HDX 8.9" tablet I received earlier this month. I rate it 5 stars despite the lower-case keyboard letters being much smaller than the lower-case keyboard letters on the older Kindle Fire HD 8.9" tablet I have. I haven't been able to figure out why Amazon made the change to the keyboard. On the new HDX tablet, it is easy to accidentally tap 2 lower-case letters due to the smaller letters being so close together. In any event, I love the tablet and won't rate it lower based solely on the smaller lower-case letters on the keyboard. Maybe Amazon will read my review and design a down-loadable "fix" for it. Here's hoping....
customer_reviews.author: sampson

customer_reviews.title: A big disappointment from a family of otherwise good tablets
customer_reviews.text: I am a huge Amazon Fan, this was my third Fire but this one was such a disappointment. Video is great, screen is a good size, the sound is wonderful. But it locks up way too often! You will be playing a video and then it will suddenly freeze, hold the power button twenty seconds and it resets but really who has time for that? Only for it to do it a few hours later. I would encourage you not to buy this until Amazon fixes their HDX's. Or get a cheaper one, my old one works great but for all the money this one was not a good value.
customer_reviews.author: Dad 2019

customer_reviews.title: Not sure if it's worth the price.
customer_reviews.text: I'm only giving 3 stars because it's actually not really any better than the Fire before this and it's very expensive. It's only been two weeks and I know I have to get used to it. The clarity is great and the movies load quickly only if your wifi is fast. Nice size to handle very thin and light. When you first turn it on it comes up with advertisements which was so irritating but customer service helped me take that feature off. I'll have to say that customer service is outstanding.
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love My Fire
customer_reviews.text: No issues at all. I installed the Verizon chip and had the Verizon folks add the Fire to my account. Using the built-in hot spot, the Fire has become the access point to my home network. HD movies are crisp and bright. I do recommend a good quality headset as the built-in speakers are not that good. The only weak point is that the amazon app for movies won't download a movie using 4G. Anything bigger that 50MB needs Wi-Fi to download. I have no idea why that is, but there you are. So you may want W-Fi at home to download movies to watch later. I also suggest you get the 64GB memory.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Buchmiller

customer_reviews.title: Makes reading fun again.
customer_reviews.text: The Fire HDX 8.9 makes reading fun again. I have one of the original Kindles and this is a lot better. Books, magazines, a few games, email, and the web ... who could ask for anything more. the colors really pop of the screen. The auto lighting of the screen display is great for reading in bed and turning out the lights. You can see the screen start to dim ... little by little, not all at once. Haven't had a chance to try to read outside in direct sun. But then the 7 feet of snow we've received in the Boston area of the past 3 weeks may have something to do with that.
customer_reviews.author: PMac

customer_reviews.title: Really Bad Experience for the second time
customer_reviews.text: Worst machine I've ever used. started to freeze and then shut itself off the same day I got it. Then it wouldn't shut off after freezing up on the 2nd day until the battery died. After trying all of the so called "fixes", They are sending me a replacement. We'll see how this one works. My last one died after just 14 months so if this one isn't any better, it will be the last one I ever buy.
customer_reviews.author: Joyce Collins

customer_reviews.title: Fire HDX Provides Reading Comfort
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the Fire HDX because of declining vision. This tablet is making reading more comfortable for me because of the choice of background colors, as well as the choice of type sizes. In addition, the larger screen, as opposed to my Kindle, makes for a more normal reading pattern, with much less page turning. I realize that most purchasers would be interested in all the other features of this product, but for me, being able to continue read comfortably was the chief factor.
customer_reviews.author: Kathryn M. Young

customer_reviews.title: Had those things been included or easily accessible, I'd give it a 6 Star rating
customer_reviews.text: Had I done more research and known it did not support many Google apps or YouTube, I probably would not have purchased it. Had those things been included or easily accessible, I'd give it a 6 Star rating. I bought it for downloading movies and such from Prime. It does that perfectly... It also allows me to check Gmails with ease! Sooo, as Gmails were in it's sales pitch I assumed all Google apps were included. Not the case.
customer_reviews.author: The Judge

customer_reviews.title: Not happy but was while it lasted.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a replacement for a tablet. I wanted something made for reading mostly and thought this would be the best thing. After having it for two weeks the screen would flash off and on. When I would try and wake it up from sleep mode it would freeze and I would have to power cycle it and I was doing this almost all the time. Since I didn't get the extended warranty I basically now have a paper weight.
customer_reviews.author: TxVetteCa

customer_reviews.title: Great Customer Service
customer_reviews.text: I received the Fire HDX 8.9 and charged it to 100%, then played games on it for about a half hour, turned it off and went to bed. It was dead the next morning. I charged it back up to 100%, played games for maybe 15 minutes and turned it off. Battery life was down to 46% in a couple of hours. I sent it back and Amazon sent me a replacement. It did the same thing. Battery drains quickly even when turned off. I sent it back for a refund. Customer Service was excellent for both returns. Too bad I have to pay return shipping for the leather case because I no longer need it.
customer_reviews.author: MrsCls

customer_reviews.title: Completely Failed in Less than 2 Years of Use
customer_reviews.text: As of July 2 2018 this item no longer functions. The Micro USB port no longer functions. Amazon ONLY response is offering a discount on a new device. There is no Amazon certified repair station. There are no repair recommendations from Amazon. After this experience I will never purchase anything that is Amazon branded. I recommend the same for all Amazon customers or potential customers.
customer_reviews.author: Fritz Alexander Cooper

customer_reviews.title: ... a little over a year ago and I have loved it. Paid almost five hundred for it
customer_reviews.text: Bought this a little over a year ago and I have loved it. Paid almost five hundred for it, in monthly payments. Just finished paying for it and now the battery won't keep a charge longer then two or three hours. And it's my understanding that the battery is not replaceable from what I am reading on the comments. It sounds like the life expectancy of the battery is about two years. So, that would make the one expensive disposable device. SAD.
customer_reviews.author: S. R. Brooks

product_meta.title: Fire HDX 8.9 Tablet, 8.9" HDX Display, Wi-Fi, 16 GB - Includes Special Offers
feature_bullets: All-new Amazon Underground, a one-of-a-kind app store experience where over $10,000 in apps, games and even in-app items are actually free – including extra lives, unlocked levels, unlimited add-on packs and more
Incredibly light design, weighing just 13.2 ounces
Exclusive 8.9" HDX display with over 4 million pixels (339 ppi / 2560 x 1600)
Enjoy more than 33 million movies, TV shows, songs, books, Android apps and games
8 MP rear-facing camera and front-facing 720p HD camera
Ultrafast 2.5 GHz quad-core processor for quick app launches and fluid graphics
Free, live video support 24x7, 365 days a year with Mayday
2 GB of RAM, with 16, 32, or 64 GB storage and free unlimited cloud storage for Amazon content and photos taken with your Fire devices
Rich, multi-dimensional audio with crisp, clear sound and no distortion
Stay connected with fast web browsing, and email and calendar support including Gmail and Outlook
